newsitem.title: UK: Highland Timber posts premium on AIM debut.
newsitem.headline: Highland Timber posts premium on AIM debut.

text.p: Shares in Highland Timber Plc rose on Tuesday to a six percent premium on their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) but dealers described the volume as thin.
Highland shares, issued at 120p, gained 7-1/2p to 127-1/2p by 1114 GMT.
Highland raised over eight million stg from an offer for subscription and said it aimed to establish a forest portfolio which will be restocked as felling takes place.
The group has bought three forests in the UK and said it is looking to buy a forest in New Zealand where Highland said timber grows approximately 40 to 50 percent quicker than in the UK.
